docs.snippet: The United States and Israel are discussing the possible release of Jonathan Pollard, an American serving a life sentence in North Carolina for spying for Israel....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States and Israel are discussing the possible release of Jonathan Pollard, an American serving a life sentence in North Carolina for spying for Israel.
docs.abstract: Obama administration is discussing release of Jonathan Pollard, American convicted of spying for Israel more than quarter of century ago, as it struggles to avert collapse in peace talks between Israel and the Palestinians; Israel has long sought release of spy, who is serving life sentence in North Carolina, but United States has steadfastly refused.

headline.main: U.S. Is Weighing Release of a Spy for the Israelis
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Weighing Release of a Spy for the Israelis

byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Michael R. Gordon from Jerusalem. Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Mark Mazzetti from Washington.
byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

headline.main: Global Warming and the Developing World

docs.snippet: The death of an innocent bystander has left the city wondering how what the police said was a petty turf war between “crews” of children could breed such random, deadly violence....
docs.lead_paragraph: The death of an innocent bystander has left the city wondering how what the police said was a petty turf war between “crews” of children could breed such random, deadly violence.
docs.abstract: Murder of an innocent bystander by 14-year-old Brooklyn student Kahton Anderson leaves New York City wondering how petty turf war between 'crews' of children could breed such random, deadly violence; although city's murder rate has dropped sharply, police say clashes between teenage crews, mini-gangs that grow out of blocks or housing projects, now account for 30 percent of all shootings.

headline.main: An 8th Grader, a Gun and a Bus Rider in the Way
headline.print_headline: An 8th Grader, a Gun and a Bus Rider in the Way

byline.contributor: J. David Goodman, Michael Schwirtz and Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting.
